channel.title: ::mute
channel.description:
I need a ::mute command anyone have?
For all the Yz85Racer out there let me phrase diff for u
I f u h a v e a : : m u t e c o m m a n d c a n i h a v e i t

item.title: ::mute
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Thecheeseman11, post:26, topic:154952”]D D 3 whenever I am testing the mute and unmute it keeps saying player does not exist… do they have to be online or something?

I made a random name then logged off and logged on my other name and typed ::mute (the random name)

and it said Player does not exist…do they gotta be online?[/quote]
Thecheeseman11, I would say they have to be online. Unless you change the command to manually parse the userfiles and add that they’re muted.

Read full topic

item.title: ::mute
item.dc:creator: @D_D_3 D D 3
item.description:
@D_D_3 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:13, topic:154952”][quote author=D D 3 link=topic=211605.msg1850602#msg1850602 date=1193561676]

if (command.startsWith("mute") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(5); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.muted = 1; p.sendMessage("You have just been muted by "+playerName+"!"); sendMessage("You just muted "+command.substring(5)+""); } else { sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Please enter a name that you wish to mute"); } }

Unmute:

if (command.startsWith("unmute") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(7); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.muted = 0; p.sendMessage("You have just been un-muted by "+playerName+"!"); sendMessage("You just un-muted "+command.substring(7)+""); } else { sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Please enter a name that you wish to un-mute"); } }
[/quote]
Not to point out the obvious, but that code is horrible. It breaks nearly every convention hahahahaha.
Remember, proper programming practise is to only catch what is needed.
Also, indented code is alot easier to read.[/quote]

Mmh kay the code is fine for me except the mute is a lil glitch but it works fine on my server to.

Read full topic

item.title: ::mute
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“D D 3, post:12, topic:154952”]if (command.startsWith("mute") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(5); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.muted = 1; p.sendMessage("You have just been muted by "+playerName+"!"); sendMessage("You just muted "+command.substring(5)+""); } else { sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Please enter a name that you wish to mute"); } }

Unmute:

if (command.startsWith("unmute") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(7); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.muted = 0; p.sendMessage("You have just been un-muted by "+playerName+"!"); sendMessage("You just un-muted "+command.substring(7)+""); } else { sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Please enter a name that you wish to un-mute"); } }[/quote]
Not to point out the obvious, but that code is horrible. It breaks nearly every convention hahahahaha.
Remember, proper programming practise is to only catch what is needed.
Also, indented code is alot easier to read.

Read full topic
